definition: to notate music/to write a score
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: Systems of notation differ widely throughout history and from culture to culture.
sentences.chinese: 整个历史和各民族的记谱方法千差万别。

sentences.english: There is notation for the amount of the 13th century Cologne teaching of the founding Blanco Shifu.
sentences.chinese: 有量记谱法为13世纪科隆教士弗兰科创始。

sentences.english: All the selected rhyme schemes are notated according to recordings.
sentences.chinese: 所有唱腔选段均依据录音记谱。

sentences.english: Music notation is a general term to describe the writing down of music.
sentences.chinese: 音乐记谱法是指音符通用书写方法。

definition: traditional Chinese musical notation using Chinese characters to represent musical notes
to read a score/to read music
tuning (stringed instrument)/(fig.) to make up one's mind
music notation in which the notes Do, Re, Mi, Fa, Sol, La and Si are represented by numerals 1 to 7
(music) fingering/(TCM) manipulation of acupuncture needles/(keyboard) typing technique/(dance) hand movements/(painting) finger method
names of the notes of a musical scale (e.g. C, D, E or do, re, mi)
